riddles:
I am neither inside nor outside but I am in every house. Who am
I?

I have a house full of milk and crunchy food inside and the husk
all over my shell. I am a fruit growing in tall tree in Africa and
Islands. Who am I?

I am born tall, but I die very short. I am used inside the house.
Who am I?

I have ten servants that obey to my orders; they help me
whenever I need them. They nourish me, help me wear my
clothes and they turn the pages of my book when I am reading.
They never argue among themselves, who are they?

A dad and his son were riding their bikes and crashed. Two ambulances came and took them to different hospitals. The man’s son was in the operating room and the doctor said, “I can’t operate on you. You’re my son.”
How is that possible?
Throw away the outside and cook the inside, then eat the outside and throw away the inside. What is it?
answer: Corn on the cob, because you throw away the husk, cook and eat the kernels, and throw away the cob.
